Pmog

This class is the controller for the extension.  It acts as a marshal between the pmog server and the various classes making requests.  Much of the logic for how the app should handle specific game senerios are handled in this class.

This class is instantiated in the extension overlay file.

Summary
Pmog
This class is the controller for the extension.
Functions
Pmog
Initializes the Object
init
Initializes the mouse movement listener, which we use to determine if the user is actually playing or just has the browser window open.
private_url
In order to balance the traffic on the server we make extension specific calls to ext.pmog.com
private_track_url
This function will tell pmog.com, which webpage the user just loaded.

Once a page is loaded this function starts the process of preparing the page to receive overlay events.

Initiates the tracking request for the page loaded in the user’s browser.

Send the tracking request to pmog.

Show or hid the pmog hud based on the protocol of the active tab.

Returns the instance of the Page class associated with the selected tab.

Returns the instance of the Page class associated with the tab whose id corresponds to the panel_id parameter.

Returns the instance of the Display class associated with the tab whose id corresponds to the panel_id parameter.

Returns the instance of the Display class associated with the selected tab.

This function formats the returned JSON object from the server into a format the extension expects.
parse_page_objects
The function iterates over the attributes of the obj sent by the server and stores them into a new istance of the Page class.

This function will render any overlays stashed in the provided page object to the screen.

Render a specific page object type to the display.

The notify function instructs the Display instance to render a single overlay message to the browser.
handle_server_message_response
This function will parse an json object and send it to the display to be parsed
request_deploy_action
This function handles requests made by other classes to deploy tools or execute other game related functionality.
has_inventory
This function will return a boolean value depending on the inventory levels of the tool specified in the parameter.
user_verification_params
Certain remote calls to the pmog server require a valid user session and a unique authenticity token to prevent against CSRF attacks.
user_idle
This function determines if the player has moved their mouse since a timer event elapsed.
mouse_moved
This function is called anytime the player moves the mouse.
get_user_messages
This function queries the server for new messages for a player.
user_playing
This function determines if the user is presently logged into PMOG.
page_validated
Page actions require a page object to be returned from the pmog server.

Functions

Pmog

Pmog = function(namespace)

Initializes the Object

init

Pmog.prototype.init = function()

Initializes the mouse movement listener, which we use to determine if the user is actually playing or just has the browser window open.

private_url

Pmog.prototype.private_url = function()

In order to balance the traffic on the server we make extension specific calls to ext.pmog.com

private_track_url

Pmog.prototype.private_track_url = function()

This function will tell pmog.com, which webpage the user just loaded.

page_loaded

Pmog.prototype.page_loaded = function(tab)

Once a page is loaded this function starts the process of preparing the page to receive overlay events.  This function, creates a new display object for the tab, and then passes a reference of the loaded page to the display object.  Then it adds a custom dom element called a mailbox to the browser’s DOM.  The mailbox will be used for communication between the extension’s privileged code and the browser’s unprivileged code.  Finally, the current location is passed along to the tracking function to retrieve the page objects to display.

Parameters

tabthe instance of the tab class that triggered this event.

track_uri

Pmog.prototype.track_uri = function(a,
panel_id)

Initiates the tracking request for the page loaded in the user’s browser.  Note that secure pages (starting with HTTPS://) are not tracked.

Parameters

alocaltion object
panel_ida string representing the tab, which contains the page to be tracked.

send_track_request

Pmog.prototype.send_track_request = function(a,
panel_id)

Send the tracking request to pmog.

Parameters

aA location object
panel_ida string representing the tab, which contains the page to be tracked.

site_blocked

Pmog.prototype.site_blocked = function(url)

Determine if a url appears in the blocked site list as defined by the white lists database

Parameters

urlLocation object of the url to check

Returns: true or false

toggle_hud_for_protocol

Pmog.prototype.toggle_hud_for_protocol = function(protocol)

Show or hid the pmog hud based on the protocol of the active tab.

Parameters

protocolthe protocol of the active tab.

get_page

Pmog.prototype.get_page = function()

Returns the instance of the Page class associated with the selected tab.

Returns

page object or null;

get_page_by_panel_id

Pmog.prototype.get_page_by_panel_id = function(panel_id)

Returns the instance of the Page class associated with the tab whose id corresponds to the panel_id parameter.

Parameters

panel_idthe id of the tab to find.

Returns

page object or null;

get_display_by_panel_id

Pmog.prototype.get_display_by_panel_id = function(panel_id)

Returns the instance of the Display class associated with the tab whose id corresponds to the panel_id parameter.

Parameters

panel_idthe id of the tab to find.

Returns

display object or null;

get_display

Pmog.prototype.get_display = function()

Returns the instance of the Display class associated with the selected tab.

Returns

display object or null;

handle_server_response

Pmog.prototype.handle_server_response = function(obj,
panel_id,
clobber)

This function formats the returned JSON object from the server into a format the extension expects.

Parameters

objJSON object sent by the server
panel_idThe panel_id of the tab, which the obj is to be associated with.
clobberBoolean If true then the method will create a new page object instead of appending the page objects to an array of exisiting items.

parse_page_objects

Pmog.prototype.parse_page_objects = function(opts)

The function iterates over the attributes of the obj sent by the server and stores them into a new istance of the Page class.  If there are no errors it hands off the page object to the show_all_page_objects_for_page function to handle the rendering of the overlays.

Parameters

opts = Object containing at least two keys opts.page_objects - Hash Contains the page objects returned from the server opts.panel_id - String Reference to the tab, which to render the page objects to. opts.clobber - Boolean If true then the method will create a new page object instead of appending the page objects to an array of exisiting items.

show_all_page_objects_for_page

Pmog.prototype.show_all_page_objects_for_page = function(the_page)

This function will render any overlays stashed in the provided page object to the screen.  This function is also helpful if you want to show the page items that were previously hidden by the extension.

Parameters

the_pageinstance of the Page class, which contains the overlays to render to the DOM.

show_page_object_type

Pmog.prototype.show_page_object_type = function(items,
panel_id)

Render a specific page object type to the display.

Parameters

itemsArray of page items to render to the screen.
panel_idThe panel_id of the corresponding tab, which will receive the rendered overlays.

notify

Pmog.prototype.notify = function(opts,
panel_id)

The notify function instructs the Display instance to render a single overlay message to the browser.

Parameters

optsObject containing the message object
panel_idThe panel_id of the corresponding tab, which will receive the rendered overlays.

handle_server_message_response

Pmog.prototype.handle_server_message_response = function(obj)

This function will parse an json object and send it to the display to be parsed

Parameters

objThe JSON object to parse.

request_deploy_action

Pmog.prototype.request_deploy_action = function(type,
event)

This function handles requests made by other classes to deploy tools or execute other game related functionality.

Parameters

typea string describing the type of deploy action requested.
eventThe event that triggered this action (usually a mouse click).

has_inventory

Pmog.prototype.has_inventory = function(type)

This function will return a boolean value depending on the inventory levels of the tool specified in the parameter.  In addition, if the user does not have any of the specified tool it will display an flash message to the browser.

Parameters

typeA string of the tool type to query the player’s inventory against.

Returs

true or false

user_verification_params

Pmog.prototype.user_verification_params = function()

Certain remote calls to the pmog server require a valid user session and a unique authenticity token to prevent against CSRF attacks.  This method will return those values formated for use in a query string.

Returns

string

user_idle

Pmog.prototype.user_idle = function()

This function determines if the player has moved their mouse since a timer event elapsed.

Returns

true or false

mouse_moved

Pmog.prototype.mouse_moved = function(e)

This function is called anytime the player moves the mouse.

get_user_messages

Pmog.prototype.get_user_messages = function()

This function queries the server for new messages for a player.  It will only make the request if the user is logged in and they are not idle.

user_playing

Pmog.prototype.user_playing = function()

This function determines if the user is presently logged into PMOG.

Returns

true or false

page_validated

Pmog.prototype.page_validated = function(type)

Page actions require a page object to be returned from the pmog server.  Without a page object all deploy actions will fail, therefore do not trigger these methods without a page object and page.id.

Parameters

typeThe type of action requested.

Returns

true or false

The Page class is a container, which loads all of the elements that may appear on a loaded page.

Pmog.prototype.get_display_by_panel_id = function(panel_id)
Returns the instance of the Display class associated with the tab whose id corresponds to the panel_id parameter.
Used by the extension to handle the rendering of overlays and events to the browser viewport.
